column4: displayName
Software Metadata (CodeMeta v2.0)
description
Version of the software instance, usually following some convention like SemVer etc.
Description of development status, e.g. work in progress (wip), active, etc. See repostatus.org for more information.
Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human-readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex, institutional GitLab instance, Gitea, etc.).
Type of software application, e.g. Simulation, Analysis, Visualisation.
Subcategory of the application, e.g. Arcade Game.
The programming language(s) used to implement the software (e.g. Python, C++, Matlab, Fortran, Java, Julia,...)
Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (e.g. Java 11, Python 3.10 or .Net Framework 4.8).
Operating systems supported (e.g. Windows 10, OSX 11.3, Android 11).
Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies. If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.
Link to installation instructions/documentation
Required software dependencies
Name and version of the required software/library dependency
Link to required software/library homepage or documentation (ideally also versioned)
Optional dependencies, e.g. for optional features, code development, etc.
Name and version of the optional software/library dependency
Link to optional software/library homepage or documentation (ideally also versioned)
Minimum memory requirements.
Processor architecture or other CPU requirements to run the application (e.g. IA64).
Minimum storage requirements (e.g. free space required).
Permission(s) required to run the code (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).
Link to help texts or documentation
Link to the README of the project
Link to release notes
Link to continuous integration service
Link to software bug reporting or issue tracking system
identifier
concept
wip
active
inactive
unsupported
moved
suspended
abandoned
